article.headline: Jackson St. 75, Grambling St. 59
article.story: JACKSON, Miss. -- Garrison Johnson scored 25 points and Jackson State defeated Grambling State 75-59 on Saturday. Johnson hit a 3-pointer with 16:27 left in the first half to give Jackson State (7-11, 5-1 Southwestern Athletic Conference) a 15-1 lead, and it never looked back. Jackson State shot 54.5 percent form behind the arc (6 of 11) in the first half and built a 39-26 lead at halftime. Tyrone Hanson had 18 points, and De'Saun Dixon scored 15 and grabbed 12 rebounds for Jackson State, which outrebounded Grambling State 50-32. Grambling State (4-9, 2-3) pulled within 49-40 on Ariece Perkins' jumper with 9:41 remaining, but wouldn't get any closer. Jackson State answered with five straight points and led 54-40 on two free throws by Rod Melvin with 8:34 left. David Qualls scored 25 points and Perkins added 20 for Grambling State, which lost its third straight.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
